H0.text: What word, deriving from centuries-old papal custom, refers to favouring/favoring relatives in awarding responsibility and authority. Patronage

H1.text: What word, deriving from centuries-old papal custom, refers to favouring/favoring relatives in awarding responsibility and authority. Clientelism

H2.text: What word, deriving from centuries-old papal custom, refers to favouring/favoring relatives in awarding responsibility and authority. Cronyism

H3.text: What word, deriving from centuries-old papal custom, refers to favouring/favoring relatives in awarding responsibility and authority. Nepote

A4.text: The term comes from the Italian word nepotismo, which is based on the Latin root nepos meaning nephew.

A5.text: Since the Middle Ages and until the late 17th century, some Catholic popes and bishops – who had taken vows of celibacy and, therefore, usually had no legitimate offspring of their own – gave their nephews such positions of preference as were often accorded by fathers to sons.
